result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial/scheduling conference on January 5, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Approved to appear via zoom on 09/22/22. Signed by RMW on 09/20/22. arc

Clerk spoke with Atty. Zimmerman regarding obtaining DE's signature for bond. Atty. Zimmerman will advise DE to come to Clerk of Court office once released from treatment to sign bond. Atty. Zimmerman indicated it will be early in the week of 9/26/22. Clerk left unsigned bond at counter of Clerk's office. kma

AMENDED

$2,500 bond on file.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

9:12 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Melstrom, Clk: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Nicholas M Zimmerman in court for Trevor Jakeb Brink. Defendant Trevor Jakeb Brink appeared by video. Atty. Zimmerman requests additional STC and bond modification. Court modifies bond. DE will be leaving treatment tomorrow and Atty. Zimmerman will facilitate DE signing bond. Court sets PSC. Adjourned: 9:14 AM. kma

for DE to appear via zoom. Filed by Atty Zimmerman. arc   to RMW
Filed by ADA Becker. arc    to Atty Zimmerman.

$2500 bond on file.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device with a restriction to be within a 100 mile radius from St. Croix County Courthouse. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

01:05 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Attorney Nicholas M Zimmerman in court for Trevor Jakeb Brink.  Defendant Trevor Jakeb Brink in court. Atty Zimmerman requests to modify bond to extend GPS restriction to 100 miles to allow DE to attend treatment in MN. Court cancels PH and sets PSC. Court grants modification of bond. Adjourned at 1:10 PM.  gll

Pretrial Assessment Report. SEALED w/ access to parties.  gll

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device with a restriction to be within a 50 mile radius from St. Croix County Courthouse. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:04 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trevor Jakeb Brink appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas M Zimmerman in court for Trevor Jakeb Brink. Court notes Atty Zimmerman is appearing for today only, but will file retainer if retained. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. Court orders bond. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets PH. Atty Zimmerman states DE has a diabetic cat and DE will need to use syringes to administer. Atty Zimmerman requests DE be able to go to treatment if outside of 50 mile GPS. Court would like Atty Zimmerman to file letter regarding treatment and will determine at that time.  gll
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
